profile.profileName: PBCore at the University of Georgia
profile.profileDescription: A PBCore-based profile created by University of Georgia Special Collections Library (Walter J. Brown Media Archives And Peabody Awards Collection), USA

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Description narrative pour l'ensemble. Il s'agit du texte principal utilisé lors d'un affichage public de l'élément.

label.name: Introduktion
label.description: Berättande beskrivning, för gruppering. Detta är den primära texten som används när grupperingen visas offentligt.

label.description: Narrative description for item in this set. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the item in the context of this set.

label.description: Narrative description for item in this set. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the item in the context of this set.

label.description: Description narrative pour un élément de cet ensemble. Il s'agit du texte principal utilisé lors d'un affichage public d'un élément dans le contexte de cet ensemble.

label.name: Post beskrivning

label.description: Determines how set is rendered when displayed to the public in the Pawtucket/Pawtucket2 front-end.

label.name: Is primary item for set?
label.description: The item marked as primary will be used to represent the set as a whole when included in a list of sets.

label.name: Is primary item for set?
label.description: The item marked as primary will be used to represent the set as a whole when included in a list of sets.

label.name: Est l'item principal de l'ensemble ?
label.description: L'item marqué comme principal sera utilisé pour représenter l'ensemble comme un tout dans l'affichage d'une liste d'ensembles.

label.name: Är det primära objektet för gruppering?

label.description: Informations additionnelles à propos du mouvement de l'objet ou d'un groupe d'objets.

label.name: Förflyttning anteckning

label.description: The purpose or reason for the movement of the object or group of objects.

label.description: The purpose or reason for the movement of the object or group of objects.

label.name: pbcoreAssetType
label.description: Still need to create a list for this element if we decide to use it at all. The metadata element indicates the broad editorial format of the assets contents.

label.name: pbcoreAssetDate
label.description: This is the date when this work was broadcast, published, performed or otherwise presented to this world.

label.name: pbcoreIdentifier
label.description: This is the collectionName_itemNumber identifier in brown, 2001003psr in Peabody

label.name: pbcoreSubject: Library of Congress Subject Headings
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Description
label.description: The metadata element description uses free-form text or a narrative to report general notes, abstracts, or summaries about the work of a media item you are cataloging. The information may be in the form of a paragraph giving an individual program description, anecdotal interpretations, or brief content reviews. The description may also consist of outlines, lists, bullet points, rundowns, segment sequence, edit decision lists, indexes, or tables of content. The descriptor descriptionType is a companion metadata field to the element description. The purpose of descriptionType is to identify the nature of the actual description and flag the form of presentation for the information.

label.name: Relation
label.description: The descriptor relationType identifies the type of work bond between a media item you are cataloging and some other related media item.

label.name: Spatial Coverage
label.description: The pbcoreCoverage element is a container for subelements coverage and coverageType.

label.name: Spatial Coverage
label.description: The descriptor coverage uses keywords to identify a span of space or time that is expressed by the intellectual content of a media item. Coverage in intellectual content may be expressed spatially by geographic location. Actual place names may be used. Numeric coordinates and geo-spatial data are also allowable, if useful or supplied. Coverage in intellectual content may also be expressed temporally by a date, period, era, or time-based event. The PBCore metadata element coverage houses the actual spatial or temporal keywords. The companion descriptor coverageType is used to identify the type of keywords that are being used.

label.name: Temporal Coverage
label.description: The pbcoreCoverage element is a container for subelements coverage and coverageType.

label.name: Temporal Coverage
label.description: The descriptor coverage uses keywords to identify a span of space or time that is expressed by the intellectual content of a media item. Coverage in intellectual content may be expressed spatially by geographic location. Actual place names may be used. Numeric coordinates and geo-spatial data are also allowable, if useful or supplied. Coverage in intellectual content may also be expressed temporally by a date, period, era, or time-based event. The PBCore metadata element coverage houses the actual spatial or temporal keywords. The companion descriptor coverageType is used to identify the type of keywords that are being used.

label.name: Annotation
label.description: The descriptor annotation is a stand-alone PBCore element where you can catalog any supplementary information about a media item or the metadata used to describe it. Annotation clarifies element values, terms or descriptors; and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: pbcoreCreator
label.description: The pbcoreCreator element is a container for sub-elements creator and creatorRole.

label.name: Creator
label.description: The descriptor creator identifies a person or organization primarily responsible for creating a media item. The creator may be considered an author and could be one or more people, a business, organization, group, project or service.

label.name: Creator Role
label.description: Use the descriptor creatorRole to identify the role played by the person or group identified in the companion descriptor creator. Unlike print resources, there is usually no single role, like an author, who has primary responsibility for the creation of media items such as audio, video, and film assets and their digital renditions. For these media, creators identified as the primary creator can fill many different roles, such as the instructor for a video course, the interviewee from a video history program, or the director of a program or film.

label.name: pbcoreContributor
label.description: The pbcoreContributor element is a container for sub-elements contributor and contributorRole.

label.name: Creator
label.description: The descriptor contributor identifies a person or organization that has made substantial creative contributions to the intellectual content within a media item. This contribution is considered to be secondary to the primary author(s) (person or organization) identified in the descriptor creator.

label.name: Contributor Role
label.description: Use the descriptor contributorRole to identify the role played by the person or group identified in the companion descriptor contributor.

label.name: Rights
label.description: Use the descriptor rightsSummary as an all-purpose container field to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over a media item, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified, as needed.

label.name: Rights Summary
label.description: Use the descriptor rightsSummary as an all-purpose container field to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over a media item, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified, as needed.

label.name: Extension
label.description: The descriptor extension accommodates metadata descriptions crafted by metadata dictionaries and schemas outside of the PBCore Metadata Dictionary Project. These extensions fulfill the local metadata requirements for communities and stations identifying and describing their own types of media with specialized, custom terminologies.

label.name: Instantiation Identifier
label.description: This is used to record any other identifiers that are used to identify an object OTHER THAN the unique ID

label.name: Date
label.description: Use the descriptor instantiationDate to specify the creation date for a particular instantiation of a media item.

label.name: Dimensions
label.description: The instantiationDimensions element specifies the visual dimensions to expect when rendering a particular instance of media.

label.name: Physical Format
label.description: Use the descriptor instantiationPhysical to identify the format of a particular instantiation of a media item as it exists in an actual physical form that occupies physical space (e.g., a tape on a shelf), rather than as a digital file residing on a server or hard drive.

label.name: Digital Format
label.description: Use the descriptor instantiationDigital to identify the format of a particular instantiation of a media item as it exists in its digital form, i.e., as a digital file on a server or hard drive. Digital media formats may be expressed with formal Internet MIME types.

label.name: Item Location
label.description: The descriptor instantiationLocation is considered to be an address for a media item. For an organization or producer acting as caretaker of a media resource, instantiationLocation may contain information about a specific shelf location for an asset, including an organization’s name, departmental name, shelf ID and contact information. The instantiationLocation for a data file or web page may include domain, path, filename or html page.

label.name: Item Location
label.description: The descriptor instantiationLocation is considered to be an address for a media item. For an organization or producer acting as caretaker of a media resource, instantiationLocation may contain information about a specific shelf location for an asset, including an organization’s name, departmental name, shelf ID and contact information. The instantiationLocation for a data file or web page may include domain, path, filename or html page.

label.name: Container Type
label.description: Does the barcode refer to a box or other container? Or a tray location?

label.name: Container Label (if applicable)
label.description: Used to help identify the container by some other means than a barcode

label.name: Media Types
label.description: The descriptor instantiationMediaType identifies the general, high level nature of the content of a media item. It uses categories that show how content is presented to an observer, e.g., as a sound, text or moving image.

label.name: Generation Types
label.description: The descriptor instantiationGenerations identifies the particular use or manner in which an instantiation of a media item is used, e.g., Audio/Narration or Moving image/Backup master.

label.name: File Size
label.description: Use the descriptor instantiationFileSize to indicate the storage requirements or file size of a digital media item. As a standard, express the file size in bytes.

label.name: Time Start
label.description: The descriptor instantiationTimeStart provides a time stamp for the beginning point of playback for a time-based media item, such as digital video or audio. Use in combination with instantiationDuration to identify a sequence or segment of a media item that has a fixed start time and end time.

label.name: Duration
label.description: The descriptor instantiationDuration provides a timestamp for the overall length or duration of a time-based media item. It represents the playback time.

label.name: Data Rate
label.description: The descriptor instantiationDataRate expresses the amount of data in a digital media file that is encoded, delivered or distributed, for every second of time. Although optimal data rates are often dependent on the codec used to compress and encode a digital file, generally speaking, a larger data rate translates into a better quality playback experience (e.g., 56 kilobits/second is lesser quality than 1 megabit/second).

label.name: Colors
label.description: The descriptor instantiationColors indicates the overall color, grayscale, or black and white nature of a media item, as a single occurrence or combination of occurrences in or throughout the media item.

label.name: Tracks
label.description: The descriptor instantiationTracks is simply intended to indicate the number and type of tracks that are found in a media item, whether it is analog or digital. (e.g. 1 video track, 2 audio tracks, 1 text track, 1 sprite track, etc.) Other configuration information specific to these identified tracks should be described using instantiationChannelConfiguration.

label.name: Channel Configuration
label.description: The descriptor instantiationChannelConfiguration is designed to indicate the arrangement or configuration of specific channels or layers of information within a media item’s tracks. Examples are 2-track mono, 8- track stereo, or video track with alpha channel.

label.name: Language
label.description: The descriptor language identifies the primary language of a media item’s audio or text. Alternative audio or text tracks and their associated languages should be identified using the descriptor instantiationAlternativeModes.

label.name: Alternative Modes
label.description: The descriptor instantiationAlternativeModes is a catch-all metadata element that identifies equivalent alternatives to the primary visual, sound or textual information that exists in a media item. These are modes that offer alternative ways to see, hear, and read the content of a media item. Examples include DVI (Descriptive Video Information), SAP (Supplementary Audio Program), ClosedCaptions, OpenCaptions, Subtitles, Language Dubs, and Transcripts. For each instance of available alternativeModes, the mode and its associated language should be identified together, if applicable. Examples include ‘SAP in English,’ ‘SAP in Spanish,’ ‘Subtitle in French,’ ‘OpenCaption in Arabic.’

label.name: Essence Track
label.description: The instantiationEssenceTrack element allows for grouping of the essenceTrack related elements and their repeated use.

label.name: Track Type
label.description: (audio, video, text, etc.)

label.name: Track Identifier
label.description: the alphanumeric identifier of the track defined by a technical metadata extraction tool or other track metadata reader

label.name: Track Standard
label.description: (NTSC, PAL, ATSC, etc.)

label.name: Track Encoding
label.description: The descriptor trackEncoding identifies how the actual information in a media item is compressed, interpreted, or formulated using a particular scheme.

label.name: Track Data Rate
label.description: the amount of data encoded or delivered in this track for for every second of time (8 mb/s, 1930 kb/s, etc)

label.name: Track Frame Rate
label.description: for moving image tracks: frames per second of moving image display (24 fps, 29.97 fps, etc.)

label.name: Playback Speed
label.description: Just what it sounds like

label.name: Track Sampling Rate
label.description: For a media item (specifically audio), the descriptor essenceTrackSamplingRate measures How Often data is sampled when information is digitized. For a digital audio signal, the sampling rate is measured in kilohertz and is an indicator of the perceived playback quality of the media item (the higher the sampling rate, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Bit Depth
label.description: The essenceTrackBitDepth element specifies how much data is sampled when information is digitized, encoded, or converted for a media item (specifically, audio, video, or image). Bit depth is measured in bits and generally implies an arbitrary perception of quality during playback of a media item (the higher the bit depth, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Frame Size
label.description: The essenceTrackFrameSize element indicates the horizontal and vertical resolution of a format type. It may be expressed in pixels, pixels per inch, or in the case of ATSC digital TV, a combination of pixels measured horizontally vs. the number of pixels of image/resolution data stacked vertically (interlaced and progressive scan).

label.name: Track Aspect Ratio
label.description: The essenceTrackAspectRatio element indicates the ratio of horizontal to vertical proportions in the display of a static image or moving image.

label.name: Track Time Start
label.description: time stamp for the beginning point of playback

label.name: Track Duration
label.description: time stamp for the overall duration of the track

label.name: Track Language
label.description: for audio or text tracks: the primary language of the track

label.name: Track Annotation
label.description: any supplementary information about a track.

label.name: Relation
label.description: The instantiationRelation element is a container for sub-elements instantiationRelationType and instantiationRelationIdentifier to describe inter-relationships to other instantiations.

label.name: Rights
label.description: The instantiationRights element is a container for sub-elements rightsSummary, rightsLink and rightsEmbedded to describe rights particular to this instantiation.

label.name: Rights Summary
label.description: Use the descriptor rightsSummary as an all-purpose container field to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over a media item, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified, as needed.

label.name: Condition
label.description: Use for condition notes

label.name: Archivist Notes
label.description: Any archivist notes go here except for condition notes

label.name: Annotation
label.description: The instantiationAnnotation element is used to catalog any supplementary information about an instantiation of the media item or the metadata used to describe it. It clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Part
label.description: The instantiationPart element is a container to allow for multiple instantiation parts, e.g. multi-disk DVD.

label.name: Extension
label.description: The instantiationExtension element is a container to accomodate instantiation-level metadata from external systems. Use it to supplement other metadata sub-elements of ‘instantiationPart’ or ‘pbcoreInstantiationDocument’ in which it appears.

label.name: Extension element
label.description: The descriptor extensionElement provides metadata descriptions crafted into metadata dictionaries and schemas outside of the PBCore Metadata Dictionary Project. These extensions fulfill the metadata requirements for communities identifying and describing their own types of media with specialized, custom terminologies.

label.name: Extension value
label.description: Use extensionValue to express the actual data value of the label indicated by extensionElement.

label.name: Extension authority used
label.description: If metadata extensions to PBCore are assigned to a media item with the descriptor extensionElement, and the terms used are derived from a specific authority or metadata scheme, use extensionAuthorityUsed to identify whose metadata extensions are being used.

label.name: Object Category
label.description: The category of object to which the metadata applies. Preservation repositories are likely to treat different categories of objects (representations, files, and bitstreams) differently in terms of metadata and data management functions. Value should be taken from a controlled vocabulary.

label.name: Preservation Level
label.description: A value indicating the set of preservation functions expected to be applied to the object.

label.name: Object Characteristics
label.description: An indication of whether the object is subject to one or more processes of decoding or unbundling.

label.name: Object Characteristics: Fixity
label.description: Information used to verify whether an object has been altered in an undocumented or unauthorized way.

label.name: Object Characteristics: Format Designation
label.description: Identification of the format of a file or bitstream where format is the organization of digital information according to preset specifications.

label.name: Object Characteristics: Format Registry
label.description: Identifies and/or gives further information about the format by reference to an entry in a format registry.

label.name: Creating application
label.description: Information about the application that created the object.

label.name: Inhibitor Type
label.description: The inhibitor method employed. State any inhibitor methods employed that might prevent or restrict access to the file (i.e. passwords, etc).

label.name: Storage
label.description: Information about how and where a file is stored in the storage system.

label.name: Viewing environment
label.description: Environment is the means by which the user renders and interacts with content. Separation of digital content from its environmental context can result in the content becoming unusable.

label.name: Environment: Software
label.description: Software environment required to render or use the object as part of the Environment references above.

label.name: Environment: Hardware
label.description: Hardware components needed by the Software referenced above or the human use of the referenced software.

label.name: Event
label.description: A designation used to uniquely identify the event within the preservation repository system.

label.name: eventDateTime
label.description: The single date and time, or date and time range, at or during which the event occurred.

label.name: Agent Identifier
label.description: The designation used to uniquely identify the agent within a preservation repository system.

label.name: Collection Extent
label.description: Describe the extent of the accession.

label.name: Collection Condition
label.description: Describe the condition of the accession.

label.name: Acquisition Date
label.description: Record the date of acquisition

label.name: Physical Formats in Collection
label.description: Use this descriptor to identify the format of groups of media item as they exists in an actual physical form that occupies physical space.

label.name: Identifier Source
label.description: The source of the authority record

label.name: Description
label.description: Narrative biography for entity. This is the primary text used to document the entity.

label.name: Source of description
label.description: Source of entity biography. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Notes
label.description: General notes about the persion or organization.

label.name: Nationality
label.description: Nationality of the person or organization.

label.name: Library of Congress Name Authorities
label.description: Accepts LOC Name Authority headings

label.name: pbcoreSubject_nonLOCNA
label.description: For non LOCNA names

label.name: Collection Date
label.description: Usually a date range for the scope of the collection

label.name: Collection Biographical Note
label.description: A biographical note regarding the donor or namesake of the collection.

label.name: Editeur de configuration de types de relation
Editeur de configuration de formulaires de recherche

label.typename: is assistant to the producer of
label.typename_reverse: has as assistant to the producer

role.name: Administrators
role.description: Confers actions needed by those administering the system

role.name: Cataloguers
role.description: Confers actions needed by those editing catalogue entries

role.name: Researcher
role.description: Allows users to only search and view - but not edit - catalogue entries

role.name: User content moderator
role.description: Allows users to moderate user generated tags and comments

role.name: test drive
role.description: Allows users to do/see most thigns, but not delete stuff, not create users

group.name: Cataloguers
group.description: Users who can add and edit catalogue entries

label.name: Advanced Object Search: Right-click field to use
